summary: This document consists of six 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit for August 10, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in continuous locked-down status (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) on tiers G, H, J, K, L, and M, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The sheets were reviewed by a Lieutenant and Captain.

events.title: MCC NY Special Housing Unit Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Staff at the MCC New York Special Housing Unit conducted 30-minute observational checks on inmates held in continuous locked-down status (administrative detention or disciplinary segregation) on six different tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) throughout the day and night.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The check sheets are dated August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the MCC.
The sheets document a standard operating procedure for observing inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The checks were conducted on six specific tiers (G, H, J, K, L, M) within the Special Housing Unit.
Each sheet contains signature lines for staff to document observations during specific 30-minute time frames throughout a 24-hour period.
The sheets were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of oversight for the monitoring procedure.
